en: Beauford Delaney sketchbook circa 1940s. Contains meditations on Walt Disney’s use of color animation and a written excerpt from ‘Simplicity in Comparison’ by Alfred Stieglitz. Delaney contemplates cameras being a visceral tool for art. Contains ink sketches of city and rural landscapes and oil pastel abstracts.

seo.description: Beauford Delaney sketchbook circa 1940s. Contains meditations on Walt Disney’s use of color animation and a written excerpt from ‘Simplicity in Comparison’ by Alfred Stieglitz. Delaney contemplates cameras being a visceral tool for art. Contains ink sketches of city and rural landscapes and oil pastel abstracts.
